crown:AdditionalMaterial.gams:textualContent: 1481446 CR_1_QS_Ak_1797-1919_015 Schriftquelle Akte 06. Juni 1894 Papier; Tinte Akten der Weltlichen Schatzkammer 1889-1894, Faszikel 28
crown:AdditionalMaterial.crown:transcription: Erneute Anfrage von Wentworth Sturgeon Budapest, 6th June 1894 May it please your Majesty I have endeavoured on four occasions when passing through Vienna to view the Regalia of the Emperor Charlemagne from whom I am descended through the Counts of Vermandois, Bellomont Earls of Leceister Neville Earls of Westmorland & Watson-Wentworth Marquisses of Rockingham in England which latter master quarterings your Majesty will see are borne by me. I have always been singularly unfortunate in my visits to your Majesty’s Treasury, its content being in course of rearrangement or being closed. I shall be returning through Vienna next week and should feel it a high favour if your Majesty would cause a special order to be sent me so that I may not again disappointed. I trust that your Majesty will excuse the liberty I take in addressing your Majesty upon a subject in which I alone am, though deeply, interested. I have the Honour to remain your Majesty’s obedient servant Wentworth Sturgeon To His Imperial and Royal Apostolic Majesty The Emperor of Austria, King if Hungary etc. etc. Präs. 11. Juni 1894 Thill Mr Wentworth Sturgeon Budapest Holzwarth’s Hotel Continental Wien am 11. Juni 1894 Als Erwiderung Ihres Hofgesuches de dato Budapest 6. Juni 1894 bin ich beauftragt mit Bedauern zu constatiren, daß die Besichtigung der Krönungs-Insignien jetzt unthunlich ist, da selbe wegen Local-Veränderungen für längere Zeit verpackt sind. Thill Exp. 11/6 21st June 1894 Sir I have to thank you for your polite note of the 11th […] and shall hope to be able to see the crown etc of the Emperor Charlemagne on the occasion of my next visit to Vienna. Your obediently Wentworth Sturgeon Count Rittar von Thill Pr. 25/6 1894 Thill
